meanings.definition: To cheat or swindle someone out of money or possessions.
meanings.sent1: He jewed his friend by taking his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: She jewed him out of his favorite toy in the trade.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox jewed the rabbit out of its carrots.
meanings.sent4: The con artist jewed the tourists with his fake jewelry.
meanings.sent5: The cunning magician jewed the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: To bargain or negotiate in a shrewd or cunning manner.
meanings.sent1: She jewed the seller down to get a better price on the car.
meanings.sent2: He jewed his way into getting a discount on the tickets.
meanings.sent3: The clever shopper jewed the store into giving her a free sample.
meanings.sent4: The sly trader jewed his way to a profitable deal.
meanings.sent5: The wise old man jewed the young salesman into a fair trade.
